fact: The human nose can detect over 1 trillion different scents.
Mount Everest is not the tallest mountain on Earth. Mauna Kea, a dormant volcano in Hawaii, is actually taller if measured from its underwater base to its peak.
The Library of Alexandria in Egypt, which was one of the largest and most significant libraries of the ancient world, was destroyed by a fire in the 3rd century AD.
Honey never spoils. You can eat 3,000-year-old honey and it will still be edible.
Russia is larger than Pluto, the dwarf planet.
The Great Wall of China is the longest wall in the world, stretching over 13,000 miles (21,000 kilometers).
A cockroach can live for several weeks without its head.
Australia is wider than the moon.
During World War II, the United States military developed a pigeon-guided missile system called Project Pigeon, but it was never put into use.
The coldest known place in the universe is the Boomerang Nebula, which has a temperature of -272 degrees Celsius (-458 degrees Fahrenheit).
The first computer mouse was invented by Doug Engelbart in 1964 and was made of wood.
The human brain has a memory capacity equivalent to more than 4 terabytes of hard drive storage.
The first website, which provided information about the World Wide Web project, went live on August 6, 1991.
The fastest land animal, the cheetah, can run up to 75 miles per hour (120 kilometers per hour).
The first ever email was sent by Ray Tomlinson in 1971. He also chose the @ symbol to separate the user from the destination address.
A lightning bolt can reach temperatures hotter than the surface of the sun, measuring up to 30,000 kelvins (53,540 degrees Fahrenheit).
The first commercially available mobile phone, the Motorola DynaTAC 8000X, was released in 1983 and weighed 2.5 pounds (1.1 kilograms).
Diamonds are not actually rare - millions of them exist in the earth's crust - but they are valuable due to their hardness and the difficulty of extracting and processing them.
The largest company in the world by revenue is Walmart, with over $500 billion in revenue in 2020.
Apple was the first publicly traded company to reach a $1 trillion market capitalization in 2018.
The most expensive domain name ever sold was 'LasVegas.com', which was sold for $90 million in 2005.
The world's first stock exchange was established in Amsterdam in 1602, known as the Amsterdam Stock Exchange (now known as Euronext Amsterdam).
The highest valued company in history was Saudi Aramco, which had a market capitalization of $2.03 trillion in 2019.
The first ever product to be sold on Amazon.com was a book called 'Fluid Concepts and Creative Analogies: Computer Models of the Fundamental Mechanisms of Thought' by Douglas Hofstadter.
The term 'unicorn' is used to describe a startup company that has reached a valuation of $1 billion or more.
